Vocabularies.Definition: assume that (sth.) is true without questioning it; benefit from without showing appreciation  认为……理所当然
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He seemed to take it for granted that he should speak as a representative.

Vocabularies.Definition: be valid or relevant for  对……适用
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Expenditure on health in most of these countries has gone down, and the same is true of education.

Vocabularies.Definition: 理论上
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The plans are good in theory, but they won't work in practice.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  discover 察觉，发觉
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The dentist could detect no sign of decay in her teeth.

Vocabularies.Definition: especially 尤其
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He stressed that point in particular.

Vocabularies.Definition: with regard to  有关；关于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Several men are detained in connection with the robbery.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.     dependable 可靠的，可信赖的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It's not reliable to judge a man only by his looks.

Vocabularies.Definition: (used to introduce one of two or more possible reasons for sth.) 首先一点，一来
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  For one thing, people now enjoy a higher standard of living.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   fixed or unchanging 稳定的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Markets are flourishing and prices are stable.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 轨道  v. 绕……轨道而行
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Most planetary orbits are not circles but ellipsis.

Vocabularies.Definition: for example  例如
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I've lived in many cities, for instance, Boston, Chicago and Detroit.

Vocabularies.Definition: be likely to (do) 有……倾向，易于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It's apt to be cold in the evenings.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a gradual process of developing 演变，进展，发展
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The space program is the evolution of years of research.

Vocabularies.Definition: that is to say  换言之，换句话说
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  In other words, when the wind is blowing at 120 kilometers per hour, most waves will be about twelve meters.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  	 the fact or state of existing 存在
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The elephant is the largest land animal in existence.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  having the ability required for a specific task 有能力的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She is proud of her son, who's very capable as a driver.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.     carry on through; last; suffer patiently 持久；耐久；忍耐
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His fame will endure for ever.

Vocabularies.Definition: deal with conclusively; get rid of, throw away 处置，解决；除掉；扔掉 dispose v. settle or regulate  处理，处置
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We have to dispose of that pile of old papers and magazines.

Vocabularies.Definition: 在……的过程中
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The firm is now in the process of moving the main equipment to a new place.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  宇宙，世界
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Our world is but a small part of the universe.
